intro: Norrisia malaccensis var. major, commonly known as the Malacca Norrisia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. The leaves are usually elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
